title: Fence Permit Requirements and Application Process
content:
## Fence Permit Requirements - City of Doral

### Do I Need a Permit?
Yes, a building permit is required for all fence installations in the City of Doral.

### Requirements:
- **Maximum Height**: 6 feet for rear/side yards, 4 feet for front yards
- **Setback**: Fences must be within property lines
- **Materials**: Wood, vinyl, aluminum, chain-link, or masonry
- **DERM Approval**: Required before permit issuance - Call (305) 372-6502

### How to Apply:

**Step 1: Obtain DERM Approval**
- Contact Miami-Dade DERM at (305) 372-6502 or (305) 372-6503
- Get written approval for fence installation

**Step 2: Prepare Documents**
- Completed Permit Application (available at cityofdoral.com/building)
- Site plan showing fence location and dimensions
- Property survey
- DERM approval letter

**Step 3: Submit Online**
- Visit the Citizen Self-Service (CSS) Portal: https://energovcss.cityofdoral.com
- Create an account or log in
- Select 'Apply for Permit' and choose 'Fence'
- Upload all required documents
- Pay applicable fees online

**Step 4: Inspections**
- Schedule inspection after fence installation
- Call Building Department or schedule online

### Fees:
- Fence Permit: Approximately $75-$150 (varies by linear footage)
- Processing fee: $25

### Contact:
- **Building Department**: (305) 593-6700
- **Email**: building@cityofdoral.com
- **Location**: 8401 NW 53rd Terrace, 2nd Floor, Doral, FL 33166
- **Online Portal**: https://energovcss.cityofdoral.com

### Processing Time:
- Standard review: 5-7 business days
- Walk-through (small residential): Same day if submitted before 10 AM
summary: Fence permits are required in Doral. Apply online through the CSS Portal at energovcss.cityofdoral.com. You'll need DERM approval, a site plan, and property survey. Contact Building Department at (305) 593-6700.

title: Report Vandalism or File Non-Emergency Police Report
content:
## Filing a Non-Emergency Police Report for Vandalism

### Quick Options:

**Option 1: Online via Doral 311 (Recommended)**
- Visit: https://cityofdoral.com/311 or https://seeclickfix.com/doral
- Select 'Report Graffiti or Vandalism'
- Fill out the form with incident details
- Upload photos if available
- Submit and receive a tracking number

**Option 2: Call Police Non-Emergency Line**
- **Phone**: (305) 593-6699
- Available 24/7 for non-emergency reports
- An officer will take your report over the phone

**Option 3: Visit in Person**
- **Location**: Doral Police Department
- **Address**: 6100 NW 99th Avenue, Doral, FL 33178
- **Hours**: 24/7 for report filing
- Bring photo ID and any evidence/photos

### Information Needed for Report:
- Your name and contact information
- Location of incident (address or nearest cross streets)
- Date and time of incident (or when discovered)
- Description of damage
- Photos of damage (if available)
- Estimated value of damage
- Any witness information
- Suspect description (if known)

### What Happens Next:
1. You'll receive a case number
2. Report is assigned to an officer for investigation
3. You can request a copy of the police report after 3-5 business days
4. To obtain your report: Visit /Departments/Police-Department/Obtain-a-Police-Report

### For Graffiti Specifically:
- Report via Doral 311 for fastest removal
- City crews will remove graffiti from public property within 48 hours
- Private property owners are responsible for removal but can get assistance

### Contact Information:
- **Police Non-Emergency**: (305) 593-6699
- **Doral 311**: https://cityofdoral.com/311
- **Emergency**: 911
- **Police Records**: (305) 593-6699 ext. 7100
summary: Report vandalism online at cityofdoral.com/311, call Police Non-Emergency at (305) 593-6699, or visit the Police Department at 6100 NW 99th Avenue. You'll need incident details and photos if available.

title: Youth Programs and Child Registration
content:
## Youth Programs - City of Doral Parks & Recreation

### Current Programs Available:

**SPORTS LEAGUES:**
- **Youth Basketball League** (Ages 6-14) - $75 residents / $95 non-residents
- **Youth Soccer League** (Ages 4-16) - $75 residents / $95 non-residents
- **Youth Baseball/Softball** (Ages 5-14) - $75 residents / $95 non-residents
- **Flag Football** (Ages 5-14) - $75 residents / $95 non-residents
- **Youth Broncos Cheer** (Ages 5-14) - $100 residents / $120 non-residents

**SWIM LESSONS:**
- **Location**: Doral Aquatic Center, 3005 NW 92nd Avenue
- **Classes**: Parent & Tot, Preschool, Learn to Swim, Advanced
- **Cost**: $150-$185 per session
- **Schedule**: Twice weekly, 30-45 minute classes

**ENRICHMENT PROGRAMS:**
- **Coding and Robotics** (Ages 7-14) - STEM education
- **Ge-Ni-U-S Science Labs** - Hands-on science experiments
- **Crafty Art** - Arts and crafts programs
- **Karate** - Florida Karate Clubs at Doral Central Park
- **Aikido** - Martial arts training

**CAMPS:**
- **Summer Camp** (June-August) - Full day programs
- **Winter Camp** - During school breaks
- **Spring Break Camp** - Week-long programs
- **Holiday Camps** - Special themed camps

### How to Register:

**Online Registration (Recommended):**
1. Visit: https://cityofdoral.com/parks
2. Click 'Program Registration' or use CivicRec portal
3. Create an account or log in
4. Browse available programs
5. Select program and session
6. Complete registration and pay online

**In-Person Registration:**
- **Doral Central Park**: 3005 NW 92nd Avenue
- **Doral Legacy Park**: 11400 NW 82nd Street
- **Morgan Levy Park**: 5300 NW 102nd Avenue
- Bring: Child's birth certificate, proof of residency, payment

### Required Documents:
- Child's birth certificate (original or certified copy)
- Proof of Doral residency (utility bill, lease, or deed)
- Medical clearance form (for sports)
- Emergency contact information
- Payment (credit card, check, or cash)

### Resident Discount:
Doral residents receive discounted rates. Proof of residency required.

### Contact:
- **Parks & Recreation**: (305) 593-6600
- **Email**: doralparksinfo@cityofdoral.com
- **Website**: cityofdoral.com/parks
- **Doral Central Park**: (305) 593-6677
- **Doral Legacy Park**: (305) 593-6678
summary: Youth programs include sports leagues, swim lessons, camps, and enrichment programs. Register online at cityofdoral.com/parks or in person at Doral Central Park. Residents receive discounted rates with proof of residency.

title: Report a Pothole or Submit Service Request
content:
## Report a Pothole - City of Doral

### Quick Online Reporting (Fastest Method):

**Doral 311 Portal:**
- **Website**: https://cityofdoral.com/311
- **Direct Link**: https://seeclickfix.com/doral
- Available 24/7
- Track your request status online

### Step-by-Step Instructions:

**Step 1: Access Doral 311**
- Go to cityofdoral.com/311 OR
- Download the SeeClickFix app on your phone

**Step 2: Select Issue Type**
- Choose 'Pothole' or 'Street/Road Repair'

**Step 3: Provide Location**
- Enter the street address or intersection
- Use the map to pinpoint exact location
- The more specific, the faster the repair

**Step 4: Add Details**
- Describe the size of the pothole
- Note if it's a hazard to traffic
- Upload a photo (highly recommended)

**Step 5: Submit**
- Provide your contact information (optional but helpful)
- Click Submit
- Save your tracking number

### Alternative Reporting Methods:

**Phone:**
- **Public Works Department**: (305) 593-6740
- **Hours**: Monday-Friday, 7:30 AM - 5:00 PM

**Email:**
- publicworks@cityofdoral.com

**In Person:**
- Doral Government Center
- 8401 NW 53rd Terrace, Doral, FL 33166

### What Happens After You Report:
1. Request is logged and assigned a tracking number
2. Public Works reviews and prioritizes based on severity
3. Crew is dispatched for repair
4. You receive notification when completed (if contact provided)

### Response Time:
- **Emergency hazards**: Within 24 hours
- **Standard potholes**: 3-7 business days
- **Major repairs**: Scheduled for next available crew

### Important Notes:
- City only repairs potholes on PUBLIC roads under City jurisdiction
- Private roads/HOA roads: Contact your property management
- County roads (NW 36th St, NW 87th Ave): Call Miami-Dade 311
- State roads (Palmetto, Turnpike): Call FDOT (866) 374-3368

### Contact:
- **Doral 311**: https://cityofdoral.com/311
- **Public Works**: (305) 593-6740
- **Email**: publicworks@cityofdoral.com
summary: Report potholes online at cityofdoral.com/311 (fastest method) or call Public Works at (305) 593-6740. Provide the exact location and photo if possible. Standard repairs completed within 3-7 business days.

title: Business Tax Receipt Renewal and Online Payment
content:
## Business Tax Receipt (BTR) Renewal - City of Doral

### Renewal Deadline:
- **Fiscal Year**: October 1 - September 30
- **Renewal Deadline**: September 30th annually
- **Sincearly start date**: July 1 (renewal notices mailed)

### Late Penalties:
- After September 30: **10% penalty**
- After October 31: **15% penalty**
- After November 30: **20% penalty**
- Additional **1.5% interest per month** after December 1

### How to Pay Online (Recommended):

**Quick Pay Portal:**
1. Visit: https://energovcss.cityofdoral.com
2. Click 'PAY INVOICES' tab
3. Enter your invoice number with 'INV-' prefix
4. Pay with credit card or e-check
5. Receive confirmation and receipt via email

**Full Portal Login:**
1. Visit: https://energovcss.cityofdoral.com
2. Log in to your account (or create one)
3. Navigate to 'My Licenses'
4. Find your BTR and click 'Renew'
5. Complete payment online
6. Print or download your renewed BTR

### Other Payment Options:

**In Person:**
- **Location**: Doral Government Center
- **Address**: 8401 NW 53rd Terrace, 1st Floor
- **Hours**: Monday-Friday, 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM
- **Accepted**: Cash, check, credit card

**By Mail:**
- Mail payment with renewal notice to:
  City of Doral - Business Licensing
  8401 NW 53rd Terrace
  Doral, FL 33166
- Include check payable to 'City of Doral'
- Allow 7-10 business days for processing

### Required for Renewal:
- Current state professional license (if applicable)
- Updated certificate of liability insurance
- Any required inspections must be current
- No outstanding code violations

### Fees:
- BTR fees vary based on business type and size
- Typical range: $50 - $500 annually
- Miami-Dade County BTR also required (separate fee)

### Contact:
- **Business Licensing Division**: (305) 593-6631
- **Email**: btrlicensing@cityofdoral.com
- **Online Portal**: https://energovcss.cityofdoral.com
- **Location**: 8401 NW 53rd Terrace, Doral, FL 33166
summary: BTR renewal is due September 30th annually. Pay online at energovcss.cityofdoral.com using the Quick Pay feature. Late payments incur 10-20% penalties plus interest. Contact Business Licensing at (305) 593-6631.

title: City Council Meeting Schedule and Agenda
content:
## City Council Meetings - City of Doral

### Next Scheduled Meeting:
- **Date**: Thursday, January 15, 2026
- **Time**: 10:00 AM (Morning Session) and 6:00 PM (Evening Session)
- **Location**: Doral Government Center, Council Chambers
- **Address**: 8401 NW 53rd Terrace, Doral, FL 33166

### January 15, 2026 Agenda Highlights:
- Call to Order and Roll Call
- Pledge of Allegiance
- Approval of Minutes from December 18, 2025
- Proclamations and Presentations
- Public Comments (3 minutes per speaker)
- Consent Agenda Items
- Resolution: FY2026 Budget Amendment for Parks Improvements
- Ordinance: Zoning Text Amendment for Mixed-Use Districts
- Discussion: Downtown Doral Streetscape Project Update
- Discussion: 2026 Summer Camp Program Fees
- City Manager's Report
- Council Member Comments
- Adjournment

### Regular Meeting Schedule:
- Council meets on the **1st and 3rd Thursday** of each month
- **Morning Session**: 10:00 AM - 12:00 PM
- **Evening Session**: 6:00 PM - 8:00 PM (or until business concludes)

### Upcoming 2026 Meetings:
- January 15, 2026
- February 5, 2026
- February 19, 2026
- March 5, 2026
- March 19, 2026

### Where to Find the Full Agenda:

**Online:**
1. Visit: https://cityofdoral.com/government
2. Click on 'Council Meetings' or 'City Clerk'
3. Select the meeting date
4. Download agenda PDF from 'Related Information'

**Direct Link:**
- Agendas posted at: https://cityofdoral.com/Government-Center/Office-of-the-City-Clerk/Council-Meetings

**When Agendas Are Posted:**
- Typically 3-5 business days before the meeting
- Final agenda with backup materials: 72 hours before meeting

### How to Watch:

**In Person:**
- Open to the public
- Seating available in Council Chambers
- Public comment period available

**Live Stream:**
- Watch live on the City's YouTube channel
- Visit: cityofdoral.com and click 'Watch Live'

**Recorded Meetings:**
- Past meetings available on YouTube
- Also archived on city website

### Public Participation:
- Sign up for public comment at the meeting
- Each speaker gets 3 minutes
- Must sign speaker card before agenda item is called

### Contact:
- **City Clerk's Office**: (305) 593-6730
- **Email**: cityclerk@cityofdoral.com
- **Website**: cityofdoral.com/cityclerk
- **Address**: 8401 NW 53rd Terrace, Doral, FL 33166
summary: The next City Council meeting is Thursday, January 15, 2026 at 10:00 AM and 6:00 PM at Doral Government Center. Find agendas at cityofdoral.com/Government-Center/Office-of-the-City-Clerk/Council-Meetings. Contact City Clerk at (305) 593-6730.

title: Doral 311 Service Request Portal
content:
## Doral 311 - Your One-Stop Service Request Portal

### Access Doral 311:
- **Website**: https://cityofdoral.com/311
- **Direct Portal**: https://seeclickfix.com/doral
- **Mobile App**: Download SeeClickFix (iOS/Android)

### What You Can Report:

**Public Works:**
- Potholes and road damage
- Streetlight outages
- Sidewalk repairs
- Drainage issues
- Street sign damage
- Irrigation problems

**Code Compliance:**
- Overgrown grass/weeds
- Illegal dumping
- Abandoned vehicles
- Noise complaints
- Illegal signage
- Property maintenance issues

**Parks:**
- Park maintenance needs
- Playground equipment issues
- Trail maintenance
- Graffiti removal

**Police (Non-Emergency):**
- Vandalism
- Graffiti
- Suspicious activity
- Traffic concerns

### How It Works:
1. Select issue category
2. Enter location
3. Add description and photos
4. Submit request
5. Receive tracking number
6. Get updates via email/app

### Contact:
- **Doral 311**: https://cityofdoral.com/311
- **Phone**: (305) 593-6725
- **Email**: constituentservices@cityofdoral.com
summary: Doral 311 at cityofdoral.com/311 lets you report potholes, streetlight outages, code violations, park issues, and more. Available 24/7 online or via SeeClickFix app.

title: Building Permits General Information
content:
## Building Department - Permit Information

### Permits Required For:
- Fences
- Patios and covered terraces
- Pergolas and trellises
- Pavers, slabs, driveways
- Window/door replacement
- Sheds and screen enclosures
- Pools, spas, and decks
- Outdoor kitchens
- Additions and renovations
- Roofing repairs
- Electrical work
- Plumbing work
- A/C replacements

### How to Apply:
1. Visit: https://energovcss.cityofdoral.com
2. Create account or log in
3. Select 'Apply for Permit'
4. Upload required documents
5. Pay fees online
6. Schedule inspections

### Contact:
- **Building Department**: (305) 593-6700
- **Email**: building@cityofdoral.com
- **Location**: 8401 NW 53rd Terrace, 2nd Floor
- **Hours**: Monday-Friday, 7:00 AM - 5:00 PM
summary: Apply for building permits online at energovcss.cityofdoral.com. Contact Building Department at (305) 593-6700 for assistance.
